Context:
Program Name: Mechanical Techniques
Code: T149
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 14 weeks (2 semesters)
Starting Months: May
Domestic Tuition: $3,844.00 *
Centre: Construction & Engineering Technologies
School: Mechanical Engineering Technologies
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Program Description: Introduction to practical engineering concepts including industrial safety, dimensional inspection, machining practices, metal forming, quality control, pneumatics/electro-pneumatic circuits, embedded electronics, Computer-Aided Design (CAD), Computer-Aided Manufacturing (CAM) and Computer Numerical Control (CNC) machining techniques.
Coursework: Emphasizes practical techniques through applied learning and hands-on lab activities.
* Domestic Tuition is subject to change and may not include all fees and other expenses. Please refer to the college's official website for the most accurate and up-to-date information.

Context:
The text provides information about a fast-track certificate program offered by the college for university engineering students. The program is designed to introduce students to practical engineering concepts and lasts for two semesters. The required courses for each semester and their codes, titles, and hours per week are listed below:

Semester 1:
- MENG 1048: Machining Fundamentals (8 hours)
- MENG 1049: Mechanical CAD with SolidWorks (12 hours)
- MENG 1058: Computer Numeric Control & 2D Computer-Aided Manufacturing (4 hours)

Semester 2:
- MENG 2052: Quality Assurance (3 hours)
- MENG 1058: Computer Numeric Control & 2D Computer-Aided Manufacturing (4 hours)
- MENG 1059: Intermediate Machining (8 hours)
- MENG 1060: Electronic and Pneumatic Systems (6 hours)

The learning outcomes of the program include the ability to comply with current legislation, standards, regulations, and guidelines; contribute to quality control and quality assurance procedures; use current and emerging technologies; troubleshoot mechanical problems; interpret and prepare mechanical drawings; perform routine technical measurements; and assist in manufacturing, assembling, maintaining, and repairing mechanical components. The tuition for domestic students is $3,844.00 for the first two semesters, starting in Fall 2022.

Therefore, the extracted information is:
- Program type: Fast-track certificate program
- Duration: Two semesters
- Required courses per semester and their codes, titles, and hours:
    - Semester 1: MENG 1048, MENG 1049, MENG 1058
    - Semester 2: MENG 2052, MENG 1058, MENG 1059, MENG 1060
- Learning outcomes: Compliance with legislation, standards, regulations, and guidelines; contribution to quality control and quality assurance procedures; use of current and emerging technologies; troubleshooting mechanical problems; interpretation and preparation of mechanical drawings; performance of routine technical measurements; and assistance in manufacturing, assembling, maintaining, and repairing mechanical components
- Tuition: $3,844.00 for domestic students for the first two semesters (starting Fall 2022)

Context:
* The program starts in Fall 2022.
* Fees for the first two semesters are mentioned but are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates.
* It is a fast-track program where a full two semesters of work is completed in the May to August period.
* Students need to purchase CSA standard safety shoes and prescription safety glasses if required.
* The program is approved for OSAP funding.
* Applicants must currently be attending (or out of school for one semester) a university in Canada in a mechanical and/or industrial engineering undergraduate program.
* They must have completed university Calculus I and Engineering Strategies and Practices (or Praxis) courses or their equivalent.
* Applicants who are 18 years and younger will need to submit proof of an Ontario Secondary School Diploma in addition to post-secondary transcripts.
* College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions, more information can be found on the Transfer Guide.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
* Contact information for the School of Mechanical Engineering Technologies: phone number - 416-415-5000, ext. 4365, email - engineeringtech@georgebrown.ca, office hours - 8 a.m. – 4 p.m., room D305.
* Additional contact information for George Brown College: Contact Centre - 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.
* Information sessions are available for those who have questions about the program or their career options.
* Related programs include Mechanical Engineering Technology – Design (T121) and Mechanical Technician – CNC and Precision Machining.
